fact_check_explanation_title: McDonald’s is not reopening on 6 April in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral post claiming this has been debunked by McDonald’s.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no plan to combat the new coronavirus with helicopters spraying disinfectant
fact_check_explanation_summary: Fake advice that five helicopters are about spray the streets with disinfectant has spread all over the world

fact_check_explanation_title: Ignore these pranks on Facebook saying lockdown will be lifted in the next few days
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims circulating on April Fool’s Day have claimed the UK lockdown could be lifted in the next few days. That’s not correct.

fact_check_explanation_title: A mobile phone mast was relocated due to local concerns about school cancer cases
fact_check_explanation_summary: A mobile phone mast was relocated due to local concerns about school cancer cases. But there is no evidence to suggest the mobile phone mast caused the cancers.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Great Pyramid’s location isn’t as spooky as this post makes out
fact_check_explanation_summary: A line of latitude going through the Great Pyramid in Egypt does match the speed of light, but about 20,000 other lines go through the pyramid as well.

fact_check_explanation_title: Photo circulating of busy mosque was taken before lockdown
fact_check_explanation_summary: The photo was taken before the government ordered mosques, churches and other places of worship to close.

fact_check_explanation_title: 5G is not accelerating the spread of the new coronavirus
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence to suggest that 5G is increasing the spread of the new coronavirus.

fact_check_explanation_title: It's very rare to catch Covid-19 twice
fact_check_explanation_summary: The new coronavirus seems to produce a normal antibody response, which makes people immune afterwards, at least for a while.

fact_check_explanation_title: These trucks aren’t carrying the bodies of Covid-19 victims, and the picture wasn’t taken in Italy
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post on Facebook claimed to show military trucks carrying dead bodies in Italy. The image shows the French army on operations in Paris.

fact_check_explanation_title: Good news coronavirus list needs context
fact_check_explanation_summary: A viral list containing good news stories about Covid-19 is largely accurate, but needs some context.

fact_check_explanation_title: Home Covid-19 tests will not be readily available to the public by the end of March
fact_check_explanation_summary: You probably won’t be able to buy a new coronavirus test from Boots by the end of March.

fact_check_explanation_title: We don’t know how many people in the UK have Covid-19 and the symptom tracker app doesn’t tell us
fact_check_explanation_summary: 10% of the 650,000 people who have signed up to track their Covid-19 symptoms on a new app have symptoms. That doesn’t mean 10% of the UK has Covid-19.
